title: Question about the LoLReplay system
body:
I've been starting to use the in client replay system, which I must say is very good in regards to quality. Although the clips are saved as webm files which aren't compatible with Premiere Pro, this led me to search for a converter, most of which are scams or poor quality at best. I was wondering why the recordings are saved as webm files and not something useful such as an mp4 file etc. I would be wondering if this would be changed or added in as an option in the future.

Thanks

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=WXrykuNV,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-12-19T06:42:56.663+0000)
>
> Try utilizing [VLC Media Player.](http://www.videolan.org/)

What can VLC do for me exactly? (to be more specific im trying import these recordings into Premiere Pro)

Apologies for not addressing your post properly. 

* The type of files downloaded from replays will stay for the foreseeable future.
* I thought you were trying to view the replays with a media player as well which is why I recommended VLC.
* You could also give [VLMC](http://www.videolan.org/vlmc/) a try.

> [{quoted}](name=Rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=WXrykuNV,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-19T07:14:05.999+0000)
>
> Apologies for not addressing your post properly. 
> 
> * The type of files downloaded from replays will stay for the foreseeable future.
> * I thought you were trying to view the replays with a media player as well which is why I recommended VLC.
> * You could also give [VLMC](http://www.videolan.org/vlmc/) a try.

I have no issue with viewing the replays and the recordings as a result, the file format is my problem, but thank you for the information anyway.
If you're looking to edit the video (which I assume you'd like to do with Premiere Pro) VLMC might work.

Riot said in the future they will be implementing ways to share replays with friends etc but don't hold your breath. Probably a fair way down their priority list.

theres a list of converters on reddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/webm/comments/23ht0n/list_of_frontend_encoders_with_webm_support/

I suspect Riot uses WebM because it's the only royalty free and open source video format. Video Formats like MP4 are currently free to use in most cases, but they're still under patent by MPEGLA who can change this at any time if they wish.

As for your conversion issue, have you tried using [Handbrake](https://handbrake.fr/)? It's open source, virus free, and gratis.
